analysis of code base and code changes in progress.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*TLA Impacted:* All (But we will already have default readback as month, year for CHPC) 
----
*Problem Statement:* During readback of date in mm-dd-yyyy or any other format which has date in it, it reads one day earlier than the actual date entered by the user.
Example: 

Entered Date: 07221949

Readback format: month,day,fullYear

Expected readback: Twenty Second July Nineteen Forty Nine

Current readback: Twenty First July Nineteen Forty Nine
----
*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Change the date readback pattern in readback section of user input component by selecting chips of month, day and fullYear in this order only.
 # Now try to input any date in mmddyyyy format, example: 06252003.

----
*Expected Behaviour:* AGI should correctly readback the date entered by user. 
----
*Actual Behaviour:* AGI pronounces one day earlier than the date entered by user.

Probable issue is timezone, because currently we are transforming date from MM-DD-YYYY to new Date(), which is converting the date into the local timezone date where the code is executed.
----
*Fix required:* Say data already works correctly, so convert the date entered in **
MMDDYYYY format, and then form new date using:

 _date = new Date(+date.substring(4, date.length), +date.substring(0, 2) - 1, +date.substring(2, 4));_
----
*Tried Solutions:*

1) We tried transforming the date directly from MM-DD-YYYY format to new Date(), which gives local time of the machine where AGI is running,

2) Tried giving local timezone as parameter in the context.sayDateTime(). It works fine, but not sure how the timezone parameter works on asterisk.

3) Also tried calculating the timezone offset, and subtracting the offset from actual date, and then taking the milliseconds from it. Thus correct readback of date, but the formed date was actually ahead of expected time by (2*timezone)

Example:

Expected date: 25th July 2002 00:00

Actual date: 25th July 2002 11:00 (which is because Indian Timezone is 05:30 hours ahead of UTC, thus 11:00 is added to it)  

 

*Useful Links:*
[https://community.asterisk.org/t/asterisk-date-readback-issue/105455]
[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/79247256/asterisk-date-readback-issue]

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a user story.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
Show the calls as row per call as accoirdian and on expanding it should show all the logs for that call , show start and end time as well in table

 

By default show the exact date, dont do browser time zone changes, but there should be an option to convert the dates as well
